segment.text: "Do you want to come lie down or something?
I've got a hotel room up at the Montier."
At his inquisitive look she added,
so he lets me live there."
if we traveled in stealth though.
There might be more of those guys,"?
and the two returned to the mirror realm again,
but instead stepped into the side alley to reappear.
They didn't want to cause a scene by just popping up out of thin air in the middle of the city.
and stepped out into the street, and then inside Montier Hotel,
"Ahhh Melody, you're back, with a friend?"
Mr. Greyhem was one of the very few people
He was the father of her best friend Leah.
Melody had known Leah her whole life.
They met at about the age of five
after she was taken in by Elinor Kirke, a wealthy old woman
who was very kind but very strict.
Melody walked up to the counter
and spoke quietly to Mr. Greyhem.
"He was being chased by two thugs.”
...He can be invisible and stuff too."
And then turning toward Owen he held out a hand.
"I'm gonna go show him my room,"?
as she and Owen walked to the elevator.
Her room was on the third floor.
Rob is a professor of theoretical physics at Imperial College, London.
His thesis on “Time Folding” had figuratively and literally opened up new portals of opportunity for him professionally.
he enjoyed his tenured position teaching.
Practical application was important to him,
mere calculation of theories alone was futile.
Being a fan of the American TV show “MythBusters,” he let his students participate in physical experiments
that supported the core concepts of the theoretical treatise
At his home lab in Sussex, he worked on a new experiment based on his thesis.
It functioned like a Spinning Wheel, twisting fibers of time space and folding them on a molecular level to create
Tonight would determine once and for all
if this myth was plausible or busted.
A nervous smile kidnapped his face
as he turned to his laptop
and positioned the cursor over the “Run” button
and substitute it for my own."

A funny-looking gift from your little sister that you keep anyway.
and making the funny beeping noise at the end,
The wind in the brown grasses of November.
Milkweed seeds blowing on the wind.
Wishing on the first star of the evening.
and wanting to use it every opportunity
Annoying the heck out of your friends.
Ticking off the robot on AIM .
and rediscovering all the ornaments from last year
Throwing a stone into a still pond
Colorful glass lamps that make designs on the ceiling.
Looking at all the pretty ornaments in a gift shop
that you don’t knock something over.
Eating cherries off of a tree.
I’m just, uh, going upstairs now!”
as I rested my bike more carefully against the metal bars.
I strode through the metal door and into the house.
The jail-like features suddenly changed to be more comfortable and homey.
There was a sudden lightness to the air,
Adelle, with her usual soft glances and gentle demeaner, now looked angry.
What had I done this time?
and played with a string of her curly hair.
And, of course, there was the one, the only, Gianna.
Well, actually, it might be a clone.
how many Gianna’s we have running around here.
“Fame, you are getting out of control.”
Not the real Gianna, but not a clone.
Adelle’s hazel eyes bored into me.
when the teacher isn’t paying attention.
Praying to God like he was an old friend.
Catching snowflakes on your tongue and watching
Staring out the window at nothing in particular.
Feeling the rain at your back and the sun up ahead.
that the weather man predicted rain,
and finding it’s impeccably sunny the whole day.
Getting to a new level of a video game.
without worrying about how many carbs it has.
as you want, even it that may be the whole roll.
Dreams that reach outside of reality,
A young man, around twelve I would say,
much what I had been wearing just a moment ago.
Dirty green t-shirt, ripped, grass stained jeans,
I lifted my hand in a pathetic little wave.
“I am Maisie Beatrice Hampton, and I’ve come to see my grandmother.
The little boy looked at me curiously,
as if he were trying to read my face.
How was I supposed to get past this body guard?
The little boy returned with a clipboard, and on it was a long piece of paper.
“Hm...” He tapped his pencil on it.
“Hampton, Marie... Harrisford, Virginia... Sorry, kiddo, you’re not on the list.”
“I’m sorry, my real name isn’t Maisie.”
as a day could get, the day
the angel fell from the heavens.
It was a cold day in November,
and the only sign of life was the wind,
hissing between the brown grasses and the lifeless tree branches.
The ground was littered with shriveled leaves
that occasionally were lifted by the wind to travel several feet before dropping back to the dull grass.
that the winged shape in the sky was a sparrow,
that a bird had come out,
for it was lonely with just the hissing wind for company.
No, all the geese had left for the winter,
and it was too large now.
No, it was too large, and it’s wings weren’t open.
It wasn’t descending with control, but falling.
The creature was the flapping wildly,
It crashed loudly into the branches of the leafless apple tree,
It sounded like a hawk’s cry,
An angel, cast down from the heavens
It’s big brown wings were twisted,
and it was horribly cut from where it crashed into the tree,
and yet it’s crashing into the tree very well
for the tree slowed its fall enough
so that when it fell out of the tree,
it was not hurt as badly as it would have been if it had landed on the cold, hard ground first.
filled first with excitement and then with concern.
and occasionally it uttered a lamenting phrase in some incomprehensible language,
and tears ran down its face.
that instead of a normal nose and mouth, it had a curved bird’s beak, of the sort
I knelt beside it, not sure
if I should move it inside,
it might just injure it more.
” I said softly to the injured angel.
I stood and ran briskly across the field to the road.
The Bonesetter lived not far away from my house, in a once-colorful gypsy caravan
As a child, I had been terrified of the caravan,
partly because the Bonesetter growled and snapped at the village children,
but also because of the blood-curdling screams
when people were having their broken bones set,
Breathless, I arrived at the caravan door,
that the Bonesetter would not answer
so I kept knocking until he opened the door
you must make such a racket on my door?”
I put my foot in the way.
It had been two days since the angel fell.
The Bonesetter had splinted both its broken arm and wing,
and bandaged its various cuts with all the skill
but the angel had fallen asleep,
and hadn’t awoken until the second day,
when my ginger cat, Andante, climbed onto the angel’s chest
The angel’s eyes fluttered opened, a startling green.
Weren’t angels supposed to have blue eyes?
The angel murmured and clacked something to itself in its soft, precise language,
and stroked the cat with its unbroken hand,
Andante purred happily at the attention.
“Good morning,” I said, with not a little amount of awe.
and looked at me with a sad comprehension.
It said something in its language
It murmured a few more things to itself, in various languages,
and I saw tears in its green eyes.
Kamila Duche, heir to the Rouvelin Throne
The necklace hung to just below her collarbone,
and the pendant rested on her chest.
The rose quartz stone heart was just the size of her thumb print,
and the gold ring circled it beautifully.
Overall, the jewelry was perfectly crafted to fit her and only her.
Kamila Duche, heir to the Rouvelin throne, strode down the streets gracefully, her russet dress bustling out behind her magnificently.
rubbing her thumb over the smooth quartz surface.
It reminded her of her mother.
Her amber colored hair was pulled up into a high, upswept bun,
and she pushed back one of her escaping curls.
Her sea blue eyes pierced through onlookers.
Zen, a large, muscular man in a loose robe stood in the crowd.
How will we pull it off?”
A dark, mysterious voice answered him.
“Oh, we’ll pull it off, alright, Zen.

With a start and gasp of realization, Mariano awoke.
Impatiently he thrust away the covers
his legs dangling over the side of the bed.
Nocturnal epiphany sped through his agile young mind,
taking curves like a jack rabbit on Ritalin.
It was the only explanation for the cars, and the men.
She hadn’t been at her bedroom window all evening.
She was always at her bedroom window.
Still why was there no announcement, no search party?
Brimming with boyhood zeal and naive conviction, Mariano jumped to his feet.
Swiftly but silently he dressed, layer after layer, accessory after accessory,
until finally he was ready to go, ready for anything.
Without a second thought he was out the back door and to the woods, a one man search party.
Most importantly, he knew the quirky, secretive nature of the girl next door.
Janice could almost see the courage
if he could hear her heart racing.
you have to be the most incredible person
No one’s ever been as ridiculously perfect as you.
Not only are you outrageously beautiful and brilliant
but you also have the kindest soul ever in the history of kind souls.
how all the other girls stand to be around such an exquisite being.
They all have to hate you.
if I were a girl I would.
I’d completely give up hope of ever having a boyfriend with you around.
for me to measure up to you.
So I’m REALLY glad I’m not a girl.”
Kyle paused for a breath, Janice couldn’t catch hers.
sorry if that sounds a bit creepy
I’ll ever get over how utterly, insanely awesome you are,
” his voice was picking up speed,

his home was simulated around him.

that the Gianna standing with them was just a hologram.

our possessions and plundered them, and our hearts
Do not expect me to lament the fate of their civilization,
for it was at my hands did it fall.
The plan was of my weaving.
for I was meek, and small.
What could a human do against a giant?
Through my cunning did the giants turn against each other.
and the woman questioned her son.
and so they directed their anger at all,
Soldiers plundered the homes of their own people,
At the last, when the multitudes besieged the City,
only then did I reveal my plot,
and by then it was too late,
how it is that you don’t have a boyfriend.
how there isn’t an army of gus following you around,
what ever your lovely heart desires,”
Janice’s face was about as red
as can be imagined, yet getting redder.
he was really picking up the pace now,
what she’s got and taking advantage,

is that you’re perfect and there’s no one as awesome as you and you trump all those

and there would be nothing worse than some other guy scooping you up
and that would just really suck.”
you need to worry about that, Adelle.
over the past few days, you do realize.”
I stared right back at her annoyed look.
you think I’m being horrible, but I’m not.”
I just want to protect you.”
She would’ve gotten down on her knees

that should be protected, not me.”

what the hell he is going to do next.
He has bravely decided to get to the bottom of this whole mess
Dammit, what is Tom up to?
At this thought Todd is suddenly inspired.
He has been observing the whole scene
and disapproves of how Todd has been acting.

that boy wants to kill her.”
when Todd doesn’t react very violently to this news.

as he shuffles around the tree

Probably from when Tom fell out of the tree,
Jim eyes Todd carefully, then asks.

Without even looking at him, Todd answers, “No.
He’s waiting for a thank you or some kind of acknowledgment of his help.
He turns and stalks off toward his little house.

where three miniscule rolls of fat had appeared.
I stretched out over my bed,
twirling a dark lock of hair on my finger.
Gia came in with a bag of popcorn and another bag of Swedish Fish,
Emilie plopped the soda’s down on the bedside table.
I tugged at my tank top.
Emilie plopped down on the couch,

I got here as soon as I could.”

He falls exhausted to the ground
and the sound of the snow crunching beneath his body fills his frozen ears.
He gasps as the cold seeps through his clothes.
He can’t stop his teeth from chattering hopelessly
and his shoulders begin to shake as well.
“Noooo...” His attempted moan escapes as only a whisper.
He can hear the sound of nearby cars
driving by and he lifts an arm uselessly. ”
as though a knife is piercing through his skin and his muscles and—oh!
Tom pulls off his gloves and stares at his red hands in shock.
Weakly he begins to rub them together to stimulate some heat
As a last desperate hope he shoves his hands under his armpits.
He is finally greeted by a sliver of warmth, and he shivers in relief.
if he is left alone too much longer.
Never seen her before...” “Who, the redhead?
Sweater, jeans, blue fuzzy bucket hat?”
Did she wander down here by accident?
I better call the Memory Department.

Eclectic & bucholic as she may seem, she’s sharp.
She’s as seamless & with it as she is conspicuous.”

No one could crack it for months.”
a day before she figured it out.
It was all a musical problem,
incoherent mumbling“By the way she’s your partner next mission,
so you’d better get to know her.”
My heart skipped a beat in horror.
Pure coincidence could be an explanation,
and it sounded like a good one,
and saw from the corner of my eyes,
Jared and I hung out almost everyday,
and he was making me popular.
One Friday Jared had to visit his family in a different part of town,
and for once I had nothing to do.
and looked at my recent call list to see
if anyone would hang out today.
I looked through my contact list
and she invited me to the mall.
I swiftly put on my clothes
and was out the door in less than a few minutes.
I stopped abruptly noticing a vibration
It was a text from Jared.
and he moans softly at the touch.
as the hands pick him up
He can occasionally make out some voices, but only snippets of conversation.
He is drifting in and out of consciousness.
than the rest and his eyes flutter open and catch a glimpse of a girl
And then he is asleep again.
Someone is rubbing his arms with soapy hands.
and he is able to fully open his eyes.
Tom is astonished to find himself sitting in a white porcelain bathtub.
Not just his leg, but his back as well.
All at once the realization comes,
and then he hears a voice speak into his ear from behind.
I’ll keep you safe and warm.”
A Long Lost Memory is Found
His instinct makes him stiffen at the touch of a girl,
and begins to massage his adolescent, hairless chest.
She moves up his arms and onto his shoulders,
He can’t help but give up control.
He lets his head loll back onto her shoulder,
that her breasts are pressed against his back.
Suddenly her hands are moving downward.
She grips him by the waist and hoists him back toward her.
Instinctively he moves with her and grabs her hand.
and with the other hand begins to explore his thighs and the space between.
He gasps, his eyes wide open now.
Something in her touch has reawakened a long lost memory
tuning into the rhythm of her moving hand,
his mind elsewhere... in the past.
He is imagining that day long ago when that very special person did the same thing...
A few more hours crept by, one by one, with nothing happening.
I occupied myself by pacing the tile
and gazing out at the Chicago skyline,
and listen to my stomach purr with hunger.
Suddenly the entire floor underneath me groaned and creaked, tipping to a nearly forty degree angle.
and skidded down the slick marble floor,
the whole thing was hurtling me straight for one of the glass windows.
The soles of my feet nearly burned off from the friction
I made trying to stop myself.
and the explosion of glass reached my ears.
hundred mile-per-hour winds immediately shooting me out into the opening, spinning me around and around until -
My fingers felt cold stone underneath them.
Tiled marble floor lay underneath me.
